name: Gmail
description:
# Gmail MCP Server
![Gmail MCP Server](https://img.shields.io/badge/Gmail-MCP%20Server-blue?style=for-the-badge&logo=gmail) ![Python](https://img.shields.io/badge/Python-3.13+-green?style=for-the-badge&logo=python) ![FastMCP](https://img.shields.io/badge/FastMCP-2.8.1+-orange?style=for-the-badge) ![License](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-MIT-yellow?style=for-the-badge) _A powerful Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Gmail integration, providing comprehensive email management capabilities through a modern API interface._
## ğŸ“§ Overview The Gmail MCP Server is a high-performance, feature-rich server that enables seamless integration with Gmail through the Model Context Protocol. Built with FastMCP and Python 3.13+, it provides a comprehensive set of tools for email management, including reading, sending, organizing, and managing Gmail messages, drafts, and labels. ### âœ¨ Key Features - ğŸ” **OAuth2 Authentication** - Secure Google OAuth integration - ğŸ“¨ **Complete Email Management** - Read, send, draft, and organize emails - ğŸ·ï¸ **Label Management** - Create, update, and manage Gmail labels - ğŸ” **Advanced Search** - Powerful query-based email filtering - ğŸš€ **Streamable HTTP** - High-performance streaming capabilities ## ğŸ“š Available Tools ### ğŸ“¨ Email Management #### `list_emails` List emails in the user's Gmail account with advanced filtering options. **Parameters:** - `max_results` (int): Maximum number of emails to return (1-1000, default: 100) - `query` (str): Gmail search query - `label_ids` (str): Comma-separated list of label IDs - `category` (str): Email category filter (`primary`, `social`, `promotions`, `updates`, `forums`) - `after` (str): Date to search for emails after - `before` (str): Date to search for emails before #### `read_email` Read a specific email by ID or subject. **Parameters:** - `email_id` (str): Email ID to read - `email_subject` (str): Email subject to search for - `user_timezone` (str): User's timezone (default: "UTC") #### `send_email` Send a new email immediately. **Parameters:** - `to_emails` (str): Comma-separated list of recipient email addresses - `subject` (str): Email subject - `message` (str): Email body content - `cc_emails` (str): Comma-separated list of CC recipients - `bcc_emails` (str): Comma-separated list of BCC recipients ### ğŸ“ Draft Management #### `list_drafts` List all draft emails in the user's account. **Parameters:** - `max_results` (int): Maximum number of drafts to return (1-1000, default: 100) #### `create_draft` Create a new draft email. **Parameters:** - `to_emails` (str): Comma-separated list of recipient email addresses - `subject` (str): Email subject - `message` (str): Email body content - `cc_emails` (str): Comma-separated list of CC recipients - `bcc_emails` (str): Comma-separated list of BCC recipients - `reply_to_email_id` (str): ID of email to reply to - `reply_all` (bool): Whether to reply to all recipients #### `update_draft` Update an existing draft email. #### `send_draft` Send a draft email. **Parameters:** - `draft_id` (str): ID of the draft to send #### `delete_draft` Delete a draft email. **Parameters:** - `draft_id` (str): ID of the draft to delete ### ğŸ·ï¸ Label Management #### `list_labels` List all custom labels in the user's account. **Parameters:** - `label_id` (str): Specific label ID to fetch (optional) #### `create_label` Create a new custom label. **Parameters:** - `label_name` (str): Name of the label to create - `label_list_visibility` (str): Label list visibility (`labelShow`, `labelHide`, `labelShowIfUnread`) - `message_list_visibility` (str): Message list visibility (`show`, `hide`) #### `update_label` Update an existing label. **Parameters:** - `label_id` (str): ID of the label to update - `label_name` (str): New name for the label - `label_list_visibility` (str): New label list visibility - `message_list_visibility` (str): New message list visibility #### `delete_label` Delete a custom label. **Parameters:** - `label_id` (str): ID of the label to delete ### ğŸ”§ Email Actions #### `modify_message_labels` Modify labels and properties of an email message. **Parameters:** - `email_id` (str): ID of the email message - `add_label_ids` (list): List of label IDs to add - `remove_label_ids` (list): List of label IDs to remove - `archive` (bool): Whether to archive the message - `mark_as_read` (bool): Whether to mark as read - `mark_as_starred` (bool): Whether to mark as starred - `mark_as_important` (bool): Whether to mark as important - `apply_action_to_thread` (bool): Apply action to entire thread #### `delete_email` Delete an email message. **Parameters:** - `email_id` (str): ID of the email to delete ### ğŸ“ Attachment Management #### `list_attachments` List all attachments in an email. **Parameters:** - `email_id` (str): ID of the email to check for attachments ### ğŸ‘¤ Account Information #### `get_current_email_address` Get the current user's email address. ## ğŸ”’ Security - **OAuth2 Flow**: Secure authentication via Google OAuth2 - **Token Management**: Automatic token refresh and secure storage - **Header-based Auth**: Access tokens passed via secure headers - **No Local Storage**: Sensitive data not stored locally - **HTTPS Support**: Full HTTPS support for production deployments ## ğŸ“„ License This project is licensed under the MIT License - see the [LICENSE](LICENSE) file for details. ---
**Built with â¤ï¸ using FastMCP and Python** [![GitHub stars](https://img.shields.io/github/stars/your-repo/gmail-mcp-server?style=social)](https://github.com/your-repo/gmail-mcp-server) [![GitHub forks](https://img.shields.io/github/forks/your-repo/gmail-mcp-server?style=social)](https://github.com/your-repo/gmail-mcp-server)

toolPreview.description: List emails in the user's Gmail account with advanced filtering options.

params.max_results: Maximum number of emails to return (1-1000, default: 100)

params.label_ids: Comma-separated list of label IDs to filter by
params.category: Email category filter (primary, social, promotions, updates, forums)
params.after: Date to search for emails after
params.before: Date to search for emails before

params.reply_all: Whether to reply to all recipients
